intro: Becium obovatum subsp. crystallinum, commonly known as the crystalline becium, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its obovate leaves and strikingly white, crystalline structures that cover its stems and leaves. Native to specific regions in southern Africa, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its unique appearance makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
